content.title: Grammar
content.description:
Present Perfect Continuous tense
has/have been + verb + ing
Examples: I have been walking. We have been living in Iran.

content.title: Conversation
table: B: What time will the library be closing?
ب: چه ساعتی کتابخانه تعطیل می‌شود؟
B: Does it always close at 20:00?
ب: همیشه ساعت هشت تعطیل می‌شود؟
B: Will the library be open on Friday?
ب: کتابخانه روزهای جمعه باز است؟

content.title: Grammar
content.description:
negative Present Perfect Continuous tense
has/have not been + verb + ing
Example: I have not been eating all your sweets.

content.title: Conversation
table: A: Excuse me. I'm interested in getting a library card.
الف: ببخشید، من یک کارت عضویت کتابخانه.
B: Sure, let me give you an application form.
ب: حتماً، اجازه بدهید یک فرم درخواست به شما بدهم.

content.title: Common Phrases
table: I have a high school diploma.

content.title: Reading
content.description: The people of Iran care a lot about sports. The history of sports such as horse riding, archery and swimming in Iran dates back to three thousand years ago. In Iran both traditional and modern sports exist. Wrestling has always had many fans in Iran. The most popular sport among the people of Iran is football. Volleyball, basket, karate, bodybuilding and handball also have many fans in Iran.
